reviewText:
It's bad.  This game is more than just poor quality, it also is pretty much broken.

So here is a rundown of my experience.

- In the startup launcher, every resolution option was duplicated 10 times at least.  Like, 1920x1080x32 is listed 10 times, same with 1680x1050x32, and so on.  Strange.

- No controller support...  I know it does not imply to have any controller support on the store page, but it is a huge setback for the experience requiring the user to use the keyboard.

- No mentioning or list anywhere within the game of what the controls even are.  You have to play with it for a few minutes to figure out how to move your racer.  Spoiler: you go forward with w" and you steer with the left and right arrow keys.

- No options menu AT ALL.  There is a space in the menu for where it COULD go one day
recommended: there's no options menu in this game.\n\n- Only options are quick races and career mode.  First I tried career mode...  It seems to function
hoursPlayed: you go through the races and if you get first place you can continue to the next race.  If you fail
voteText: you have to restart that race.  There's no indication of what progress you have in your career
helpfulPercent: just that at first you will be one dirt track and on the next race it's a different track.  You get to choose a rider model
votesTotal: it will not be the model you chose!  Brilliant!\n\n- When you create your "career"
votesFunny: you enter your name.  But when you finish the race
commentsCount: it instead displays "aaaaaa" as your name.\n\n- The game has weird quirks to it
column16: like if you are headed down a straight away and you go 1 inch outside the course (still headed in the right direction
column17: maybe just cutting the corner ever-so-slightly. a big "WRONG WAY" is displayed on the screen.\n\n- Sometimes the computer's AI will need to respawn back onto the track
column18: and they might just spawn right on top of your head
column19: and you can keep racing with them on top of you.\n\n- When you "restart a race" because you didn't make first place
column20: you might break the game.  As in
column22: and you are racing in a black world which is impossible to see what you are doing.  I did race 1
column27: and then got to no-texture-world on that next attempt.\n\n- Even on a high end system
column28: the rain seemed to break the game.  I went from a super high framerate to almost unplayable when the rain started.\n\n- When "restarting a race"
column32: had to alt+F4 to get out.\n\n- Frustrated with career mode
column33: I then chose the quick race mode.  I did one race.  I stayed exactly on the track.  I was far
column34: far ahead of everyone else.  After 5-6 minutes
column35: I noticed that I was in last place.  And I was still on my first lap.  Just for fun
column37: enjoying myself at the fact that it was not triggering +1 laps every time I crossed the finish line.  I went on to do 3 more laps
column38: and still was on lap 1.\n\n- If you get stuck
column39: you cannot "reset your ATV" back onto the track.  There is no button on the keyboard to do this
column40: nor if you hit 'escape' can you expect a 'reset your ATV' option.  You have to exit the race
column41: or restart it from the beginning.\n\nShould I keep playing or is this enough reasons to not recommend the game?  Oh yeah
column42: I forgot one more thing:\n\nIn quick race mode
column43: there is a big button (when choosing your ATV) that says MODIFY.  As in
column44:
modify your ATV... but it does nothing.  I assume it's a placeholder button.

Okay I'm done.  Don't buy this game!  :)

I'll add in a compliment: there seemed to be quite a bit of variety in the quick race mode level selector.  The tracks themselves are done fairly well and is around a dozen of them.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dE6-M6R_Tg4"
column48: 81 of 100 people (81%) found this review helpful 11 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Don't waste your money, I purchased it and after 20 minutes requested a refund. This is a terrible game. It has no options, no instructions and you couldn't finish a race without crashing 1000 times if your life depended on it. I don't know how this made it into Steam. I would be embarrassed to be associated with this as a developer. Even more embarassed to ask people for money to play it, we should be paid for trying to play this garbage.


The developers stated: smooth gameplay
date: outstanding audio and visuals all designed to keep you on the edge of your seat"  I would change that to "terrible gameplay
recommended: decent audio and visuals all designed in 1999 to keep you on the edge of your toilet seat throwing up"...  Harsh
